answers.answer: We just had our first ultrasound yesterday and yes something is in there :)  I am about 16.5 weeks along now.  Because I'm 36 it seems that I have to be more careful because of my increased risk of gestational diabetes.  Has anyone else had any dietary changes that they have been making along through their pregnancy.  Taking care of our babies starts at conception.  I'm always up for more tips.  Even though this is our 3rd little one... each pregnancy is different.

I have 5 1/2 weeks to go - unless the sweet little princess takes her time (like her brother did)!  LOL  I am doing well except for achy joints in my pelvic/hip area and pregnancy hemorrhoids (just started this week)!  UGH!I haven't really had dietary changes, but I have had to remember to eat more - chasing around my 16 month old makes me forget to eat as much as I should.  I eat my meals, but probably not enough "extra" calories.  I haven't gained as much weight as when I was pregnant w/ my son, so I feel like I am a bit under where I should be at this point.  Though, the doctor doesn't seem concerned.

OMG you don't have long to go at all!!!  How exciting :)  Yes it seems so different when you have other kids to take care of when you are pregnant.   I go into a different mind frame.  I'm still careful, but I have more responsibilities that I have to maintain.  Keep us posted on your progress :D
